sermons.title: Doubt, The Sin God Hates the Most
sermons.description: Using the children of Israel, wandering in the desert, Wilkerson explains how it is that doubt in God is the sin that He hates the most.  Even though the cloud of God was present and miracles aboundedÂ…  the children of Israel sinned often by simply doubting what God can do.

sermons.title: Jonah #3: Work Beneath the Surface
sermons.description: Ed Miller shows how God putting Jonah in the same shoes as the heathen for him to see they both needed the undeserved mercy of God.  God delivered Jonah FROM the storm and BY the storm to show Himself as the God who delivers.

sermons.title: The Ultimate Test Of Faith
sermons.description: October 31, 2004 - There is no way that God can produce faith in us except through testing.. The only way God can build us up in faith is taking us through fires and seasons of testing.. Without faith we can not be a testimony to the world of God’s keeping power and deliverance.

sermons.title: When God Sends Leanness Into The Soul
sermons.description: This sermon speaks of how God sends leanness into the lives of Christians when they won’t rest in what his direction is for their lives.  Carter illustrates, through various scriptures, how Christians find themselves in dry places because they are not content in the station that God has put them in.  An illustration that Carter used was the complaining that the children went through in the wilderness when they weren’t content with the manna. The scripture that this sermon was built around was Psalm 106:15  And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.
